memberdef.argsstring: (fs_directory_entry_t *file, uint32_t start, uint32_t length, unsigned char *buffer)
memberdef.name: fs_write_file

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the filesystem driver responsible for handling all fs requests to a path and its child objects.
normalised_path
pre-normalised path (can include the filename part)
filesystem_t* driver ptr, or NULL if no attached driver (only occurs for root before the root filesystem is mounted)

briefdescription.para: Register a new filesystem.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to new filesystem information to register

simplesect.para: int nonzero on success

briefdescription.para: Find a filesystem by name.

simplesect.para: filesystem_t* Pointer to filesystem if found, or NULL

briefdescription.para: Register a new storage device.

parameterdescription.para: New storage device information to register

simplesect.para: int nonzero on success

briefdescription.para: Enable a block-level cache for a storage device.

detaileddescription.para: This attaches a new cache instance to the device if one is not already present. The cache is only created when the device has a valid sector size and read path. Devices that do not benefit from caching (e.g. ramdisks) should not call this function.

parameterdescription.para: Storage device to enable caching for.

simplesect.para: true if a cache was successfully created and attached, false if caching could not be enabled (invalid arguments, already enabled, or allocation failure).

briefdescription.para: Disable and destroy the cache attached to a storage device.

detaileddescription.para: If a cache is present on the device it will be destroyed and all resources freed. After this call, sd->cache will be set to NULL. Calling this on a device without a cache is safe and has no effect.

parameterdescription.para: Storage device to disable caching for.

briefdescription.para: Find a storage device by name.

parameterdescription.para: Name of storage device to find

simplesect.para: storage_device_t* Pointer to storage device if found, or NULL

briefdescription.para: Return a list of all registered storage devices.

simplesect.para: storage_device_t* Pointer to first entry in linked list of storage devices, NULL if list is empty.

briefdescription.para: Returns the free space in bytes for a path depending on the filesystem attached.

simplesect.para: free space in bytes

briefdescription.para: Mark blocks on a block storage as freed, as a hint to the storage device. May be sent as TRIM or other similar command.

parameterdescription.para: Number of bytes, must be a multiple of block size

simplesect.para: nonzero on success, zero on failure or not supported. Lack of support is not considered fatal.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *name, uint64_t start_block, uint32_t bytes, unsigned char *data)
memberdef.name: read_storage_device

briefdescription.para: Read blocks from storage device by name.

parameterdescription.para: Name of storage device registered by register_storage_device()
Number of bytes to read (should be modulus of block size)

simplesect.para: int nonzero on success

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *name, uint64_t start_block, uint32_t bytes, const unsigned char *data)
memberdef.name: write_storage_device

briefdescription.para: Write blocks to storage device by name.

parameterdescription.para: Name of storage device registered by register_storage_device()
Number of bytes to write (should be modulus of block size)

simplesect.para: int nonzero on success

memberdef.argsstring: (fs_handle_type_t type, fs_directory_entry_t *file, uint32_t ibufsz, uint32_t obufsz)
memberdef.name: alloc_filehandle

briefdescription.para: Create a new empty file.

parameterdescription.para: fully qualified path to new file to create
size in bytes of file to create

simplesect.para: fs_directory_entry_t* information on new file on success or NULL

briefdescription.para: Create a new empty directory.

parameterdescription.para: fully qualified path to new directory to create
size in bytes of directory to create

simplesect.para: fs_directory_entry_t* information on new directory on success or NULL

briefdescription.para: POSIX style _open function.

detaileddescription.para: opens a file for read or write access, or creates a new file.

simplesect.para: int zero on success, -1 on error

briefdescription.para: POSIX _close function, closes an open file.

simplesect.para: int zero on success, -1 on error

briefdescription.para: Seek to given position in a file.

simplesect.para: offset + origin should be <= current file size
int64_t new file position

briefdescription.para: Obtain current file position.

simplesect.para: int64_t position in file

briefdescription.para: POSIX _read function, reads bytes from an open file.

simplesect.para: int zero on success, -1 on error

briefdescription.para: Truncate a file to the new length.

simplesect.para: any data past the new length may not be recoverable.

parameterdescription.para: file descriptor of an open file

simplesect.para: int zero on success, -1 on error

briefdescription.para: POSIX _write function, writes bytes to an open file.

simplesect.para: int zero on success, -1 on error

briefdescription.para: POSIX _eof function.

detaileddescription.para: reports if we have reached the end of file marker on any open file.

simplesect.para: int zero if not EOF, 1 if EOF, -1 on error

memberdef.argsstring: (fs_directory_entry_t *file, uint32_t start, uint32_t length, unsigned char *buffer)
memberdef.name: fs_read_file

briefdescription.para: Read raw bytes from any arbitrary file.

parameterdescription.para: length of data to read, starting at the starting position

simplesect.para: int nonzero on error

briefdescription.para: Truncate an existing file to new length.

simplesect.para: Any data beyond the new length is discarded and may not be recoverable.

parameterdescription.para: New length, should be <= current file size

simplesect.para: int nonzero on success

briefdescription.para: Low level delete file.

simplesect.para: true if file was deleted

briefdescription.para: Delete a directory.

simplesect.para: true if directory was deleted

briefdescription.para: Delete a file (not a directory)

simplesect.para: int zero on success, -1 on error

briefdescription.para: Remove a directory.

simplesect.para: int zero on success, -1 on error

briefdescription.para: Retrieve file information on any arbitrary filename. The item requested can be a file, or a directory.

simplesect.para: fs_directory_entry_t* information on the file.

briefdescription.para: Attach a filesystem to a VFS directory. Do not use this function for end user features, use filesystem_mount() instead.

simplesect.para: The opaque data is optional and if included is driver-specific.

parameterdescription.para: Opaque data used by the filesystem driver

simplesect.para: int nonzero on success

briefdescription.para: Initialise the filesystem This loads the DummyFS filesystem which manages the root directory until any other driver is loaded. DummyFS is a dummy and does nothing.
Get a list of files in a directory. The directory path must be fully qualified from the root directory and must contain no trailing slash.

simplesect.para: fs_directory_entry_t* linked list of items, or NULL if empty directory

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the given path is a directory, false if it is a file.

simplesect.para: true is a directory
false is a file

briefdescription.para: High level mount function.

parameterdescription.para: VFS path to mount device/driver to

simplesect.para: int 1 for success, 0 for failure

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a human-readable string for the last filesystem error code.

detaileddescription.para: This function maps an fs_error_t code to its corresponding descriptive string. It does not reset or clear the error code - the last error value is retained until a new filesystem error is set via fs_set_error().

simplesect.para: The validity of the returned error string depends on the result of the most recent filesystem API call. If a filesystem function returns an error state (e.g. false or 0), you may call this function to retrieve a description of that error. If the function succeeded, the stored error code may be outdated.

parameterdescription.para: The fs_error_t code to translate into text.

simplesect.para: Pointer to a static string describing the error, or "Unknown filesystem error" if the code is not recognised.
